DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there is functional status of a person's kidney, one of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum and filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the functional status of a person's kidney, one of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum and filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.:Function; what something is used for.

Concepts.definition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have adequate re
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate renal function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Serum renal functional parameters, BUN and creatinine are within normal limits

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been found to have adequate renal function in the past 28 days

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been found to have adequate hepatic function in the past 28 days

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient at risk for renal dysfunction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function based on test results obtained within 28 days prior to randomization and defined as serum creatinine <= 1.5 X ULN for the lab or measured or calculated creatinine clearance >= 30 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have renal function assessed within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function within 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Elig_12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Adequate renal function, as defined below:  BUN =< 30 mg/dl within 14 days prior to enrollment.   Creatinine =< 1.7 mg/dl within 14 days prior to enrollment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function determined within 14 days prior to randomization defined as the most recent serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN or measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50mL/min using the Cockroft-Gault formula for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x ULN for the lab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient been found to have adequate renal function within 28 days prior to randomization? (as defined by protocol section 3.1.11)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text  001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function determined within 14 days prior to study entry defined as the most recent serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN or measured or calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 50mL/min using the Cockroft-Gault formula for patients with creatinine levels greater than 1.5 x ULN for the lab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function within 14 days prior to Step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have adequate renal function based on test results obtained within 28 days prior to randomization, defined as calculated creatinine clearance greater than or equal to 30 mL/min?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate renal function defined as an estimated glomerular filtration rate greater than 15 mL/min/1.73 m2 and not receiving dialysis?
